formattedAddress: 53 W 106th St, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 53 W 106th St, New York, NY 10025, USA

editorialSummary.text: Brick-lined Italian spot with a contemporary feel & a patio serving updated classic entrees & wine.

originalText.text: I recently dined at this Italian restaurant, and overall, it was a delightful experience. The food was delicious, and the staff provided excellent service. My only critique is that the serving dishes were consistently cold. While this wasn't an issue for cold dishes, warm plates would have enhanced the experience for hot meals. Despite this, the flavors and service make it a worthwhile. I would definitely come back for other dishes.

text.text: I recently dined at this Italian restaurant, and overall, it was a delightful experience. The food was delicious, and the staff provided excellent service. Despite this, the flavors and service make it a worthwhile. I would definitely come back for other dishes.

originalText.text: Great upscale date spot. Nice little dishes, plus some great larger dishes with a good mix of pasta, meat, and seafood. Great wine selection, but no liquor and few beers. So I'd recommend this for a classic Italian dining experience in a classy space. The majority of the tables are set for two, so that should give a sense for the intended audience. Staff was also very helpful.

text.text: Great upscale date spot. Nice little dishes, plus some great larger dishes with a good mix of pasta, meat, and seafood. Great wine selection, but no liquor and few beers. originalText.text: This year it was my 5th Manhattan visit and decided to try Osteria on 106 on my son in law recommendation.  For inside seating you have to call in but outside dining area can accommodate walk ins. Weather was warm so we sat out side. I ordered Cavatelli pasta and boy did I enjoy it with their white wine. Waitress was friendly and had many suggestions especially for a person like me who is on a very restrictive diet. If you are in that area and like Italian food you will enjoy this place.

text.text: This year it was my 5th Manhattan visit and decided to try Osteria on 106 on my son in law recommendation.  For inside seating you have to call in but outside dining area can accommodate walk ins. Weather was warm so we sat out side. I ordered Cavatelli pasta and boy did I enjoy it with their white wine. Waitress was friendly and had many suggestions especially for a person like me who is on a very restrictive diet. If you are in that area and like Italian food you will enjoy this place.

originalText.text:
Opening Service was lovely, they seemed to really want to start you off with the full experience - the service throughout can be a little much with many questions on whether you are enjoying your meal - this may be because I was alone or a way to check if you are finished and to bring your next course.
Gorgeous interior with some ambient music playing to set a mood.

Trio bruschetta:
I first notice the tomatoes and herbs it is overflowing and unwieldy to eat spillage is unavoidable but taste is nice, fresh tomatoes, the next is the, prosciutto, and feta, this is delicious with fresh tasting cheese, that could almost be made in house, lastly the mushrooms and cheese was fantastic the fungi cooked to perfection, a standout amongst the lot was the fresh delicious bread base.

Fettuccine Bolognese:
Very obviously Homemade pasta a distinct mouthfeel and taste, natural fresh also cooked to a nice al dente, and a slow cooked meat sauce with definite care put in, I also liked how neither part was too much it was balanced between sauce and pasta very well.
Highly recommend.

originalText.text: I am still here eating.  This is not my first time here.  I actually like the food, but the service is just not great this time.  From pushing us to order to pushing us to finish our apps because they had fired our mains already (when we asked them to please not fire the mains right away after being pushed to).  And then we waited to order a bottle of wine for 10 minutes.  When I asked to order, I was told 'I am coming.'  Never will come here again. Even though the food was actually good.
